headline: Chococonut Chip Cookies
description: This coconut-chocolate chip cookie recipe makes dozens of delicious drop cookies using pantry staples, semisweet chocolate chips, and flaked coconut.
name: Chococonut Chip Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Beat butter, white sugar, and brown sugar together with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat first egg into butter mixture. Beat second egg into mixture along with vanilla extract.

Combine flour, baking soda, and salt together in a separate bowl; stir into butter mixture until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips and coconut. Drop spoonfuls of dough 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on the cookie sheets briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: After reading what everyone said about them being more flat I just added 1/4 C. more flour and they turned out great! My husband really likes the taste of these cookies with the coconut.

I don’t think it’s fair to lower the rating when it might have been Me who screwed up but taking away 1 star because I did follow the recipe exactly only I cut it in half and Im glad I did, it was a waste of ingredients. They spread WAY too much. Was there suppose to be cornstarch??

I thought these were delicious and it’s a good cookie base whatever you add. I overcooked them about a minute or so- they were a little too brown- but honestly still moist and delicious. I got about 50 cookies out of the full recipe of what I would consider a medium size cookie. This is a winner! Thank you!
Love!
Omg these are SO good.
Amazing! These were easy to make, delicious, and turned out perfect!

This is my 1st review I have ever bothered to write and WOW !
I made these because I wanted to use up some coconut flakes and was looking for an easy chewy cookie. 
I followed the recipe but cut down cut down just a smidge on the chips. 
I did I halve the recipe to make fewer cookies.
Half this recipe would made about 36 cookies. I made the cookies a bit larger and ended up with 24 cookies. 
To make sure they were done had to bake them longer.
Sorry ...I lost track of how much longer but it was between 12-14 mins. They were not overcooked and dry . 
I'm definitely making these again .This time I will see what 12 mins cooking does to them.
The coconut is not overwhelming but is definitely there and helps give that chewiness to the cookie.
Awesome
With this recipe my cookies kept coming out flat so I took another reviewer's advice and added 1/2 stick of butter and it helped a lot. I'm sharing and eating these cookies!
Tried substituting coconut flour for gluten-free option. Cookies were very dry and crumbly. Added coconut milk and rolled dough to maintain shape. Did not yield 72 cookies. Closer to 36.
Quick and easy to make! I live at an elevation of 5300 ft and had to increase the baking time to 14 minutes. They came out yummy!

These cookies are easy to make and are delicious. I was worried that there would be to much coconut in it but tasting them after cooking them, I think it is the perfect amount. I would make them again.

These are INCREDIBLE. Don't listen to the yield - for me, using a teaspoon to roughly measure them out, I got around 36. I took others' advice and toasted my coconut, added another 1/2 stick of butter, and my coconut was sweetened so I only did 1/2 cup white sugar and 1/2 cup brown sugar. I'm having to restrain myself from eating the whole batch!!!

This recipe was made as written except in place of the flaked coconut I used dried coconut chips from Costco. This was a tasty cookie and I will make it again. Next time I will use less coconut than the recipe calls for.
I toasted my coconut on the stove and let it cool. Best cookies I’ve had in a long time!
I toasted my coconut on the stove and let it cool. Best cookies I’ve had in a long time!

This recipe is an instant favourite for us. These are AMAZING!! I subbed out half of the white sugar with coconut sugar, and changed the brown sugar to golden sugar to balance out the flavour as coconut sugar is already deep and rich. Thank you for this recipe!
Fantastic, thanks for the recommendation on an extra half stick butter and 2 tablespoons milk. These are divine!

These did come out flat, but it didn’t matter to my family because they were DELICIOUS! My son-in-law said he’d concrete our patio for a few dozen of them. I’d say that is a pretty good indication of their yummy-ness. Will make again!

This has been my weakness ever since I discovered it! Recipe nicely combines two of my favorite sweets - chocolate and coconut. 

Minor changes: I don't use salt since I use salted butter. And I do a half-n-half mix of sweetened and unsweetened coconut. 

Yum!
I had a few problems adjusting the ingredients but I made 20 and they tasted delicious! Thank you. I also added oatmeal :)

This is the new chocolate chip cookie recipe for our us. Only slight changes based on other reviews. decreased the fat by one 1/4 cup. So I used a 3/4 cup & used 50/50 combo of butter & Crisco. I had mini chocolate chips on hand & used the full 2 cups, it was too much. By the end it was a lot of chocolate & not enough dough. rough chopped almonds added in. Wow we wow these are good! didn't get 72 cookies more like 60 I think

Loving how CRISP these turn out. They are a little sticky to work with but believe me, it’s worth the trouble. I toasted the coconut and added a cup of walnuts. Next time I make these my plan is to substitute 1/2 cup of oats for 1/2 cup of the flour.

I love this recipe! I added toasted coconut (which I toasted while waiting for the oven to get to temp.
I didnt change any thing else.

Here is what I did: 
First of all.........they are AMAZING COOKIES with a nice taste and I WILL be making them again but......I am one person so the recipe got cut in half and I followed it to a "T" .... almost. I cut back on the sugar and used 1/4 C. brown and 1/4 C. white sugar and beat the snot of the butter, egg, vanilla and sugars......after it was fluffy I added the rest and only mixed until everything was incorporated. I used my large cookie scoop and baked them for 15 minutes.......edges were brown and my cookies did not "spread" out much at all. When I put the ball of dough on my cookie sheet I mushed them down a bit and got a nice, uniform (not thin) cookie. Thank you for sharing this ..... coconut lovers unite!
I made these during the holidays, and they were my daughter’s favorite. They’re easy to make, and they make a lot! A keeper!
I added an extra tsp of vanilla and 1 tsp of cream of tartar, they were yummy. Chewey and soft.
Delicious and awesome. I used almond extract instead of vanilla, and also some peanut butter chips. These are great!
One of the best cookie recipes ever - I swap out one cup of peanut butter for one cup of butter and everyone loves them!

I did make three changes.
 1) butter flavor crisco instead of butter (Fluffier texture)
2) almond extract instead of vanilla 
3) 1/2 t additional salt to offset sweetness of coconut.
Mmm...Think almond joy:-)

These were good. I was a bit short of chocolate chips so added about 1/4 cup of craisins to make the full 2 cups . I followed the recipe as shown. Made them a bit small and they were ready in 8 minutes cooking time.

My husband asked me to bake these for a twist on Chocolate Chip cookies. Looking for an added flavor to the Chips. I made them last night. Followed directions exactly. Disappointed in their flavor. Not really any different then a regular CC cookie. While you could feel the coconut in your mouth while chewing, you didn't taste any coconut flavor. Cookie was moist, but not what we wanted. One and done recipe for us.

These were AMAZING! But two tips!!! I only used 1.5 cups of chocolate chips and it was more than enough. Also, I needed to bake them for about 11 minutes to get them golden-brown. Otherwise they were still too doughy in the middle.
Excellent! They came out the perfect combination of gooey and crunchy
Added 1/2 cup of roughly chopped fresh lemon rind and 1 teaspoon of real coconut extract. Going to have to make another because they are going so fast!

these cookies are AWEsome, i only made 2 small changes,
i put half the coconut in and substituted the other half with chopped walnuts. And i used milk chocolate chips instead of semi sweet. they turned out amazing, my family were grabbing them as soon as i could get them baked :0)
5 stars!!!
best cookie ever

I love these cookies especially with a glass of milk I used 1/2 of white sugar or any substitute, 1/2 a cup of Brown sugar. Half semi sweet and half dark choco chips. Then I added 2 tablespoons of milk and they came out great and chewy.
The cookies came out good but not great. Next time I will reduce salt to half teaspoon and I will cook much, much longer. The best tasting parts of the cookies are the crispy edges.
very good, maybe less chocolate chips?
Instead of using 1 cup of butter, I used 1/2 cup butter with 1/2 cup applesauce, it was so delicious!
I made it with dark chocolate chips one time and the other time I used 1 cup milk and 1 cup white chips and it came out really well both times.

I used one less cup of flour substituting with 1 cup of oats. Also added 1/2 - 2/3 cup of dried cranberries and half milk chocolate and half semi sweet chocolate chips. Got very good reviews from family who liked it.

Hands down, these are the best cookies ever. I halved the recipe since 72 seemed like too many. I won't be doing that again. Everyone at work came back for more. The only thing I changed was adding about 5 more minutes to the baking time as we enjoy a more crunchy cookie.

These are my favorite dessert ever. Just when you thought a chocolate chip cookie couldn’t get any better! Only tip: make sure you use unsweetened coconut flakes. I used sweetened one time and I wasn’t a fan.

I only had half the chocolate suggested so I added 1/2 tsp cardamom powder and 1/2 tsp cinnamon powder and they came out great. I cooked exactly 8 min and thought they looked under cooked but I wanted to make sure they stayed soft. They were perfect after cooling completely if u love a chewy cookie. I will definitely be making them again and didn't even miss the other cup of chocolate chips I left out. Thx
Not enough coconut flavor according to the tasters so coconut extract will be added next time
EZ
My cookies turned out flat. Wouldn't make again.
I made these cookies with white chocolate chips instead and they came out even better than I'd hoped. Definitely using this recipe again.
I will definitely make these again. LOVED them although they're a little salty still really like them.

Also inspired by an abundance of leftover shredded coconut, I made these tonight and they were great. The recipe is totally basic and versatile--I subbed coconut oil for butter, and instead of two cups of chocolate chips (because I was short on those), I did one cup of chips and one cup of nuts. Easy and yummy and a little different!
So so yummy!!! thank you for sharing!!

I followed the recipe exactly and my family said they were the best cookies ever. I did beat the ingredients quite a while before adding the flour. They came out soft in the middle and crispy on the outside - and stayed that way for two weeks. They froze really well too. I liked how they coconut taste was subtle. I took them to a meeting and everyone raved about them.
The best cookies I've ever made!! great recipe!

I use this as base cookie recipe and add whatever I am feeling like for the day. I have added all kinds of nuts, white chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, coconut, chocolate chips, peanut butter chips, raisins, and cranberries. They all turn out great. I have even added all the ingredients at the same time, just keeping to the overall volume of 4 cups to the add-ins.
Always a hit!
I am certain that this is my favorite cookie so far.

I should add that I used butter flavored crisco instead of butter, which got around the 'flat' issue that some mentioned in the recipe. Instead of using chocolate chips I added chopped pecans instead --- WoNDERFUL!! One of the best coconut pecan cookies I've had. Will definitely make these again :)
Yum! Coconut and chocolate! The best of both worlds!
The best chocolate chip recipe I've ever tried! People I give them to say the same thing. (every one of them!) Thank you so much for shaving this recipe.
really good
They were pretty good. I think I over cooked them a little bit still good
Used triple chocolate chips and loved them. This is a very good recipe. The coconut....mmmmmm
This recipe is delicious as is, but I added some cocoa powder to distinguish them from regular chocolate chip cookies for those who are quick to grab without looking.
Fabulous recipe! Taking them camping.
Delicious cookies but way to thin. I will add more flour next time and maybe some oatmeal.
Absolutely fabulous!!!! I changed nothing.
I'd give 4.5 stars, simply because it's a little too sweet. Next time I may reduce the sugar a bit. These come out with a nice crunch on the edge and a chewy middle. Followed recipe exactly.
turned out great. Will make these again.

The first time I made these was to use up a bag of coconut I had in the freezer. Needless to say, I fell in love with them and have made them 6+ times since. Everyone in my house loves them and they never last more than 3-4 days. This is definitely my favorite cookie recipe.
These had a great flavor and would be delicious with pecans added to the mix.

My ingredients: 1/2 cup butter, 1 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 3/4 c applesauce, 2 eggs, 1 T vanilla, 1 3/4 c whole wheat flour, 1 1/4 c flour, 1 T baking soda, 1 T salt, 20 oz choc chips, coconut, caramel pieces, flax seed.

We love these cookies!!! If they are too flat, they need more flour. If you aren't sure about the amount of flour. I used the amount in the recipe and made one cookie. It went flat so I added more flour...then I baked one more cookie. It still wasn't enough...I added a bunch more and made one cookie and it was perfect. I made these again to determine how much flour and the total amount of flour ended up being 3 1/2 cups...substantially more than the recipe. thank you for posting this!!!!
Very good but I only put 1 cup of chocolate chips in because I'm not crazy about too much chocolate. I prefer the taste of the cookie and coconut.

Holy moly these are good!! I took the advice from another reviewer and added a 1/4 more of flour and these are literally the best cookies ever! I also added about a 1/4 cup of sliced almonds too! This will be my go to cookie!

Very yummy cookies. I followed the recipe to the letter except I cut down to 18 servings (recipe made just for the hubby and I) and that is 36 cookies, which came out at exactly the 36 count! I used my small-sized cookie scoop (just over 1" wide), and that just makes it so much easier, faster and less messy to put them out onto the cookie sheet, which I covered with parchment paper for easier clean-up later! My hubby said the flavor of these cookies was "delicious" and "totally awesome". So, this recipe is a keeper!

This is the Best chocolate coconut chip cookie my wife has ever made and she has made some freaking great cookies in our day. We followed the instructions and found them easy to make. Just a great cookie.
These are amazing! Super soft and chewy with crispy edges! Will definitely makesthese again, they tte like "Mounds" candy bars!

These cookies are delicious, and I thought the perfect texture! Though I do think (never thought I'd say this) that 2 cups is too many chocolate chips - it completely overpowers the coconut (I used unsweetened coconut chips from Trader Joes). Next time I'll let coconut have the stage.

These cookies are delicious, and I thought the perfect texture! Though I do think (never thought I'd say this) that 2 cups is too many chocolate chips - it completely overpowers the coconut (I used unsweetened coconut chips from Trader Joes). Next time I'll let coconut have the stage.
My family just thinks I’m the real deal from these simple and yummy cookies. Thanks!

I read all the previous reviews and tweaked the original just a bit ! Do these changes ! They really are the best cookie I've had in along time and I will make another batch of these fantastic taste treats before Christmas ! 

11/2 cups of softened butter
3 cups of coconut 
1tablespoon of coconut extract 
1cup of chopped pecans 
1cup of semisweet chocolate chips and
1cup of butterscotch chips 
Bake at 350 for 10 min or till edges are brown 
YUMMY!!

Great recipe! Thanks for sharing. I toasted the coconut before adding it to the recipe. I followed the recipe, except I cut sugar to 2/3 cup and brown sugar to 1/3 cup. I wanted to add coconut extract instead of vanilla, but I didn't have any on hand. This is a good recipe and I will make it again. I bet it would taste good with some chopped pecans added too.

A true go to that I know everyone will love. I've made the exact version countless times. There are also times I exchange or add in the fun ingredients. Around the holidays I love craisins or nuts or both in them. Tonight I'm adding peanut butter to half the batch and am eager to see how yummy they will be. 
I make sure to always use parchment paper. I have learned that my cookie scoop sizes varies so I just have to keep an eye on them in the oven. I pull them out when the outer bottom begins to brown. Then I leave them on the cookie sheet for about five minutes before transferring the parchment paper with the cookies on top onto a wire rack. They need to set up. 
Best cookie recipe for anyone who enjoys coconut and chocolate!
As is, this recipe is perfection, but I always have to cut it in half because hubby is starting to complain about the size of his belly and his lack of self control . :-D

Followed the recipe exactly, ended up with 6dz cookies. Next time I make these, I'll definitely add more coconut. I couldn't really tell there was any coconut - either from texture or taste. 
They did not bake up too flat, they did not taste greasy, and there were quite enough chocolate chips in them - in short other than my wanting to add more coconut next time, these cookies are good as written.

These are pretty good cookies. I adjusted the sugar just to the half cup of brown, it would have been overly sweet otherwise. The coconut and chocolate chips give the added sweetness. A little bit chewier would have made them better. They actually get better the day after they're made.
I get so many compliments on these cookies. I followed the recipe exactly and baked them in my convection oven for 10 minutes and they are perfect!
This will become a family favorite I am sure. Nice moist coconutty chocolatey gooey goodness! Can't say enough good things about this recipe!

I changed this a bit, I make this with Organic Gluten free flour and Organic agave as my older son is allergic to Wheat and we don't us processed sugar. And I use organic bittersweet chocolate chips sweetened with organic evaporated cane juice and organic unsweetened coconut flakes. NO ONE BELIEVES me when I say I did not use wheat or add sugar only agave. They are scrumptious and always a big hit at any function or just at home when I have the time to bake and need an almost healthy treat. Thanks for the recipe!
I used unsweetened shredded coconut...OH MY GOODNESS. Absolute perfection. Crispy edges, soft middles, just enough sweet with not too much...quick, easy, delicious. Absolutely awesome.
These are really good! The chocolate goes well with the coconut. I used all brown sugar and did only 1 cup of chocolate chips and 11/2 of coconut.

I am not a baker at all but I had enough stuff in the pantry to make these since the kids were asking for cookies. I also added half a cup of slivered almonds since I had those in the pantry needing to be used.And the chocolate chips I used had caramel centers. Needless to say, kid approved and will make them again.

Converted to cookie bars! Used 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 Crisco shortening and then added an extra Tablespoon of flour. Otherwise, stuck to the recipe exactly and put it in a 9x13 glass dish. Baked for ~20 mins. It's amaaaazing! Thank you for this recipe!
This was fantastic! I cut the white sugar to 3/4 c and the chips and coconut to 1.5 c each. Really great recipe! Thanks for sharing!
Turned out perfectly. Awesome.

Ahhh-mazing! I substituted out 1/2 cup of butter for coconut oil to give them a little more chewy/moist texture. They are kind of a "flat" cookie which I'm not usually a fan of but these were so good I wouldn't even try to change anything else. I've made 2 batches of these so far and every time I give one to somebody they ask for the recipe!
Absolutely delicious! I will be making them again.
